alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 4:31AM PST until December 08 at 3:52PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Thurston and Grays Harbor Counties. Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .The upper reaches of the Chehalis River crested overnight. The flood crest will move downstream reaching Grand Mound tonight and Porter on Thursday. The Newaukum River will crest this morning with the river dropping back below flood stage tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River at Porter. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood low pasture lands and some roads. High tidal levels at Aberdeen will worsen flooding along the lower reaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 47.3 feet. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon and crest at 48.4 feet tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 1245 PM PST.
